713094f-a.title: Manhattan: 42nd Street - 8th Avenue
713094f-a.text:
42nd Street, north side, from Eighth to Ninth Avenues, inclusive.
The City Subway (Independent System) is under construction
under Eighth Avenue.
February 1, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

710185f-b.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - 42nd Street
710185f-b.text:
(1)
660, bo2, ou4, odo Eighth Avenue, at and aojoining the N.E. corner
of 42nd Street. No. 664 is one of the few remaining frame houses

NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
May 1, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, after demolition. The 1-story building (in the centre) occupied
by the United Cigar Stores Company is the only floor left of what was formerly
a 3-story building. The upper two stories were demolished together with the
other buildings which occupied this site.
July 2, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

710181f.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - 42nd Street (West)
710181f.text:
667 to 671 Eighth Ave., west side, between West 42nd and 43rd Streets,
showing an excavation where No. 669 formerly stood. The Corn Exchange
Bank will erect a 1arge structure around the corner on 42nd Street and
utilize this space as an ell to same. The other structures shown remain
the same today (1938). This set consists of a negative and a positive.
December 3, 1926.
F. M. Demarest.
Gift of Albert A. Volk Co.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
